lexa.core.data.exception

Class DataException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • lexa.core.data.exception.DataException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class DataException
extends java.lang.Exception
    An exception within a DataSet or DataItem
    Since:
    2009-07
    Author:
    William
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.lang.String key
      The key where the exception occurred
      private java.lang.String path
      The path where the exception occurred

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DataException()
      Create a new exception with default text.
      DataException(java.lang.String message)
      Create a new exception with a message.
      DataException(java.lang.String message, java.lang.String path)
      Create a new exception with a message and path.
      DataException(java.lang.String message, java.lang.String path, java.lang.String key)
      Create a new exception with a message, path and key.
      DataException(java.lang.String message, java.lang.String path, java.lang.String key, java.lang.Throwable throwable)
      Create a new exception with a message, path and key.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Get the key of the DataItem where the exception occurred.

    • Field Detail

      • path

        private final java.lang.String path
        The path where the exception occurred

      • key

        private final java.lang.String key
        The key where the exception occurred

    • Constructor Detail

      • DataException

        public DataException()
        Create a new exception with default text.

        This would be equivalent to using DataException("An exception has occurred")

        See Also:
        DataException(String)

      • DataException

        public DataException(java.lang.String message)
        Create a new exception with a message.

        This would be equivalent to using DataException(message, null)

        Parameters:
        message - a message to describe the exception.
        See Also:
        DataException(String, String)

      • DataException

        public DataException(java.lang.String message,
                     java.lang.String path)
        Create a new exception with a message and path.

        This would be equivalent to using DataException(message, path, null)

        Parameters:
        message - a message to describe the exception.
        path - the path within the DataSet where the exception occurred.
        See Also:
        DataException(String, String, String)

      • DataException

        public DataException(java.lang.String message,
                     java.lang.String path,
                     java.lang.String key)
        Create a new exception with a message, path and key.
        Parameters:
        message - a message to describe the exception.
        path - the path within the DataSet where the exception occurred.
        key - the key to the DataItem where the exception occurred.

      • DataException

        public DataException(java.lang.String message,
                     java.lang.String path,
                     java.lang.String key,
                     java.lang.Throwable throwable)
        Create a new exception with a message, path and key.
        Parameters:
        message - a message to describe the exception.
        path - the path within the DataSet where the exception occurred.
        key - the key to the DataItem where the exception occurred.
        throwable - the cause of the exception

    • Method Detail

      • getKey

        public java.lang.String getKey()
        Get the key of the DataItem where the exception occurred.
        Returns:
        The key of the exception or null if omitted.

      • getPath

        public java.lang.String getPath()
        Get the path within the DataSet where the exception occurred.
        Returns:
        The path of the exception or null if omitted.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Get a string to describe the exception.

        The format of the description is "<message> [key: <key>] [path: <path>]"

        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Throwable
        Returns:
        A formated string describing the exception.
        See Also:
        Throwable.toString()
